Now, ruercronr, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (l) of

l. Short title and commencement.- (l ) This Ordinance may be called

(2) It shall come into force at once
3. Insertion of new section 4lA, Ordinance VIII of 2000.-ln the
said Ordinance, after section 41, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-
"4lA.Transfer of assets and liabilities of Alien Registration
Authority.- (l) On transfer to rhe Alien Registration Authority
(NARA) under section l7 ofthe Foreign Act, 1946(XXXIof 1946),
all employees ofthe NARA shall , subject to the following provisions,
cease to be civil servants within the meaning of the Civil ServantsAct,
1973 (LXII of 1973) and shall be deemed to have always been
appointed on comparable posts oftheAuthority, except for the purposes
offinancial benefits which shall not be admissible to them priorto the
date oftheir transfer to the Authority.
(2) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this
section, any person referred lo in sub-section ( l) may, within three
months ofthe transfer, exercise an inevocable option either to remain
civil servant or, as the case may be, become employee ofthe Autlrority:
Provided that where any person does not exercise the option
within the said period he shall be deemed to have opted to become
employee of the Authority.
3. Any person who opts under sub-section (2) to remain a civil
servant shall be provided with a comparable posting elsewhere rvithin

6. All assets and liabilities ofthe NARA including its counters and
other formations, shall, on commencement of the Foreigners
(Amendment) Ordinance, 2015, stand transferred to and vested in the

7. The Federal Govemment shall pay to the Authority capitalized
value ofpension and gratuity in respect ofemployees, transferred to
theAuthority under sub-section (l) to which they have become entitled
to or have been eamed by them or have accumulated till their transfer
to the Authority.
8. Allsuits and other legal proceedings instituted by oragainstthe
Federal Govemment and NARA in respect of the matters of the
foreigners' registration immediately before commencement of the
Foreigners (Amendment) Ordinance,20l5 shall be deemed to be suits
and legal proceedings oftheAudrority on and from such commencement
and shall be dealt with by theAuthority accordingly.
9. All debts and liao-ilities incurred, contracts entered into or rights
acquired and all matters and things done, engaged or to be done by or
for the NARA immediately before commencement of the Foreigners
(Amendment) Ordinance, 2015 shall be deemed on such
commencement to have been incurred, entered into, acquired, done,
engaged or, as the case may be, to be done by or for the Authority.".
